title: Kindred doesn't have a "capture" animation for points on Dominion.
body:
She just stands there.  Wolf keeps running around and responding to jokes and such though.

Riot officially has forgotten Dominion exists.  :P

replies.body: Appears to be a bug as she does have a capture animation
inb4 the thread is deleted by forum mod for not being in the right section

> [{quoted}](name=KING OF MASKS,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bAM26puI,comment-id=00100000,timestamp=2015-10-21T23:18:09.127+0000)
>
> inb4 the thread is deleted by forum mod for not being in the right section

Well it is gameplay... lel
But every bug is gameplay.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Whist,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bAM26puI,comment-id=0010,timestamp=2015-10-21T23:17:07.678+0000)
>
> Appears to be a bug as she does have a capture animation

**A little bit offtopic, but it's just so painful to see this:**

How do you know you have failed to create that unique dual champion you were talking about not so long ago? 

Everyone call it "SHE" instead of "THEY". Even Rioters when they refer to Kindred ;..;

> [{quoted}](name=Nublord,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bAM26puI,comment-id=00100002,timestamp=2015-10-22T03:31:25.235+0000)
>
> Everyone call it "SHE" instead of "THEY". Even Rioters when they refer to Kindred ;..;

Because everyone refers to the champion's gender of whichever one they are playing as. Kindred is Lamb and Wolf. Wolf is a he, Lamb is a she. Together, you refer to them as they. However, you don't get to play as both. You only control Lamb, which is a she, so everyone calls Kindred a she, cause they can't play as the Wolf.

The Wolf just hangs around Lamb doing whatever. Only she, Lamb, would have a capture animation. Wolf will just float around doing whatever. So both wouldn't have a capture animation, therefore "they" won't have a capture animation, just Lamb. So yes, SHE is missing her capture animation, not they.

TL;DR People call Kindred a she cause you only play as Lamb while Wolf is just an A.I. that follows you around. (Like Navi with Link in Zelda: Ocarina of Time). Basically.

Its still they though... Like Bard is not necesarily a "he" but just..."Bard". And whos to say Wolf isnt watching, and telling Lamb in her ear when to attack, etc.? Notice how Kindred's icon is not just Lamb? Each character takes part of the skills. Lamb aa's and the Q. Wolf the W and E. Both get part of the passive. And the ult is described as "Kindred preventing death" even though it is called "Lambs Respite". Although Lamb does aa's, wolf is a major part of the characters, and Kindred's name isn't," Lamb, The Eternal Hunter" Its "Kindred, the Eternal Hunter_s_. So its just grammaticlly incorrect thats all. Similar how Shaco, Draven, Soraka, are grammaticlly incorrect compared to their sonic forms. But, Riot has their own "Poetic Liscense" so its not anything bad.

> [{quoted}](name=Arakadia,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bAM26puI,comment-id=0010000200000003,timestamp=2015-10-23T00:14:18.830+0000)
>
> Its still they though... And whos to say Wolf isnt watching, and telling Lamb in her ear when to attack, etc.?

Well it's not like we get to command Wolf to tell Lamb to attack. So there's that.
How do we know we aren't commanding Wolf to tell Lamb to attack? Your just assuming your right.

Because we know that Lamb is the one who is control. She's the one with a full, physically manifested form on top of the fact that in Lamb and Wolf's lore, Lamb is the one who decides not to kill the woman nor the others. If Wolf was in control, he'd have had Lamb slaughter them all since that's simply how Wolf is.

Lamb controls Wolf much more than Wolf controls Lamb. Wolf is the one in the back, ready to pounce while lamb is cool and collected and choosing when.

> [{quoted}](name=Zair Umbras,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bAM26puI,comment-id=0010000200000003000000000000,timestamp=2015-10-28T07:26:42.818+0000)
> 
> Lamb controls Wolf much more than Wolf controls Lamb. Wolf is the one in the back, ready to pounce while lamb is cool and collected and choosing when.

^

Physically manifastation does not mean your the one in control. And the fact Lamb chooses not to kill the woment in the lore doesn't make any difference. *They still kill her in the end, and Its not up to Lamb or Wolf on how someone dies. Its the dead-to-be who either accept their end, or flee. 
You basiclly made up the "Wolf is the one in the back" because he isnt behind her. Infact hes _above_ her, possibly saying he is stronger/the majority of the 2. Neither is in control, your death is shaped by your decisions, Kindred just come as a result. 

And I dont see the difference between being ready to pounce and "choosing when". These are just steriotypes ppl have created. Similar how Riot makes Noxus seem very evil so ppl undertsand the lore more.

> [{quoted}](name=Arakadia,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bAM26puI,comment-id=001000020000000300000000,timestamp=2015-10-28T07:01:05.678+0000)
>
> How do we know we aren't commanding Wolf to tell Lamb to attack? Your just assuming your right.

Because it's in the description, stop trolling.
What do you mean "its" in the description? Be more specific.

> [{quoted}](name=Gin Gomi,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bAM26puI,comment-id=001000020000,timestamp=2015-10-22T03:51:28.071+0000)
>
> Because everyone refers to the champion's gender of whichever one they are playing as. Kindred is Lamb and Wolf. Wolf is a he, Lamb is a she. Together, you refer to them as they. However, you don't get to play as both. You only control Lamb, which is a she, so everyone calls Kindred a she, cause they can't play as the Wolf.
> 
> The Wolf just hangs around Lamb doing whatever. Only she, Lamb, would have a capture animation. Wolf will just float around doing whatever. So both wouldn't have a capture animation, therefore "they" won't have a capture animation, just Lamb. So yes, SHE is missing her capture animation, not they.
> 
> TL;DR People call Kindred a she cause you only play as Lamb while Wolf is just an A.I. that follows you around. (Like Navi with Link in Zelda: Ocarina of Time). Basically.

Aaand you are just proving my point. .-.

No, what he's trying to say is that Wolf doesn't have a capture animation. Only Lamb has a capture animation if that makes sense? In almost any other case it would be they but in this case the rioter is specifically referring to Lamb.

> [{quoted}](name=Mcrarburger,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bAM26puI,comment-id=00100002000000000000,timestamp=2015-10-22T13:04:11.654+0000)
>
> No, what he's trying to say is that Wolf doesn't have a capture animation. Only Lamb has a capture animation if that makes sense? In almost any other case it would be they but in this case the rioter is specifically referring to Lamb.

Can't you all read with comprehension? I am reffering to fact that Riot DID annouce Kindred as new uniqe to the League dual champion. However everywhere you look whenever someone says Kindred it's followed by SHE. Just like here - LOOK AT TITLE AND FIRST WORD IN POST. 

Rioter did not even notice that which was just funny and worthwile to mention, but then this guy pops up with "Because everyone refers to the champion's gender of whichever one they are playing as(...)" which exactly prove my point. When you play Kindred you think about Lamb and most of playerbase act like it was just her name.

So basically it means what I said. They kinda failed on delivering real duo champ.

Think about it this way (although I agree with you that Kindred should be referred to as "they"): Even though Kalista talks about herself in first person plural (e.g. "...that was our name.") and so does Udyr (e.g. "Our rage..." although I agree he could just be talking with the summoner, but then why would he say "...your control" because enemy summoner's couldn't hear it :P) players still refer to them as she and he, respectively. Kalista and Udyr seems like a collection of spirit (sort of I guess?) and could also be referred to (individually) as a "they" but are not.

But like I said, I agree that Kindred should be referred to as a "they" also :) Just try to look at things from the perspective of the other side.

> [{quoted}](name=Nublord,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bAM26puI,comment-id=001000020000000000000000,timestamp=2015-10-22T14:55:07.530+0000)
>
> Rioter did not even notice that which was just funny and worthwile to mention, but then this guy pops up

"Everyone call it "SHE" instead of "THEY". Even Rioters when they refer to Kindred ;..;"

I don't know. That looks like a pretty serious and sad face to me. Guess I missed the funny part. My bad then.

The flaw with the Zelda example is Link and Navi are separate entities, while Lamb and Kindred are supposed to be two parts of a single being.  So I think the example is very poor.

I don't really care if people call Kindred a She though. I mean, they're wrong to do so, but most people are gender binary, so it's natural people for them to assign a gender.

> [{quoted}](name=AbyssionKnight,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bAM26puI,comment-id=0010000200000001,timestamp=2015-10-22T15:20:08.144+0000)
>
> Lamb and Kindred are supposed to be two parts of a single being. 

^Yeah, that, and you only get to control one part of that single being which happens to be the female. So then the gender binary thing naturally comes in.
Which is why they failed on a gameplay and perception point of view to create a dual champion
Although I'm a lore nerd,it's legit to call her she since she's the main half,plus she is the physical player who captured the point

Who says Wolf isnt capturing it 2? He just has no animation. Shes also not the main half, you cant have a "main half" as half is 1/2 not 3/4. She isn't the main half just because she does aa's. Wolf takes part/causes the W and E and partly the ult. Hes even in the passive. Its not like Lulu where Pix is just a side character.

> [{quoted}](name=Arakadia,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bAM26puI,comment-id=0010000200010001,timestamp=2015-10-23T00:17:27.874+0000)
>
> Who says Wolf isnt capturing it 2? He just has no animation. Shes also not the main half, you cant have a "main half" as half is 1/2 not 3/4. She isn't the main half just because she does aa's. Wolf takes part/causes the W and E and partly the ult. Hes even in the passive. Its not like Lulu where Pix is just a side character.

Because when you joke while capturing, he gets an apple on his head, and something fires an arrow to split it.

When you laugh while capturing, he does his laugh animation.

And while Wolf exists to a degree when you press W and E, Lamb is the only part of the champion that every ability you press interacts with.

When you press Q, Lamb jumps.
When you press W, Lamb orders Wolf to stand guard.
When you press E, Lamb orders Wolf to chomp.
When you press R, Lamb creates an anti-death field.

You are playing as Lamb.  You barely play as Wolf.  In fact you interact less with Wolf than you do with Pix when you play Lulu (Q fires from Pix location, AA fires Pix bolts, E relocates Pix)

Im really stretching it. But how do you not know when Wolf does the joke and laugh, hes doing the laugh simutaniously capturing the turret telepathiclly and is in fact the "stronger/main" character because he is ordering Kindred to "capture" the turret and she has to do it for him?  

Heres a quote where Riot uses "they,"As Kindred move they build stacks of Hunter's Vigor, up to a maximum of 100. At full stacks Lamb's next basic attack drains 0 health from the target." 

Heres another way to look at _their_ abilities:

When you press Q, Wolf orders Lamb to jump and fire arrows
When you press W, Wolf breaks away from Lamb only from his own will. He is marking his terrtory.
When you press E, Wolf chomps on his own free will, possibly against Lamb's.
R: Yes Lamb is choosing to make the decision. Riot says "Just as Kindred cause death, so can they prevent it". But its both Wolf and Lambs powers. 

Sure, Riot uses "Lamb directs Wolf" twice at least, like in the following quote," Lamb can direct him to targets by attacking them". But! Whos to say Wolf doesn't direct Lamb at times like in the Q? And whos to say when shes "directing" wolf, shes just "translating" our orders as Summoners to wolf. So they are "equal" but we tell Lamb our orders because Wolf is too wild and justs loves "chasing" too much.... even if turrets are in the way. (To summarize: We tell Lamb our orders as Summoners. When we want to command Wolf, we have to ask Lamb to "direct" him as other wise he cannot or will not listen to us, as Summoners.)

> [{quoted}](name=Arakadia,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bAM26puI,comment-id=001000020001000100000000,timestamp=2015-10-23T15:09:30.345+0000)
>
> Im really stretching it. But how do you not know when Wolf does the joke and laugh, hes doing the laugh simutaniously capturing the turret telepathiclly and is in fact the "stronger/main" character because he is ordering Kindred to "capture" the turret and she has to do it for him?  
> 
> Heres a quote where Riot uses "they,"As Kindred move they build stacks of Hunter's Vigor, up to a maximum of 100. At full stacks Lamb's next basic attack drains 0 health from the target." 
> 
> Heres another way to look at _their_ abilities:
> 
> When you press Q, Wolf orders Lamb to jump and fire arrows
> When you press W, Wolf breaks away from Lamb only from his own will. He is marking his terrtory.
> When you press E, Wolf chomps on his own free will, possibly against Lamb's.
> R: Yes Lamb is choosing to make the decision. Riot says "Just as Kindred cause death, so can they prevent it". But its both Wolf and Lambs powers. 
> 
> Sure, Riot uses "Lamb directs Wolf" twice at least, like in the following quote," Lamb can direct him to targets by attacking them". But! Whos to say Wolf doesn't direct Lamb at times like in the Q? And whos to say when shes "directing" wolf, shes just "translating" our orders as Summoners to wolf. So they are "equal" but we tell Lamb our orders because Wolf is too wild and justs loves "chasing" too much.... even if turrets are in the way. (To summarize: We tell Lamb our orders as Summoners. When we want to command Wolf, we have to ask Lamb to "direct" him as other wise he cannot or will not listen to us, as Summoners.)

Except that "Lamb orders Wolf" is specifically stated in the ability's description for W and E, and again in the description of her R, Lamb is the caster.

Wolf isn't a partner, he's a thrall.  Pix is more of a two-part champion component than Wolf.
^This.
I like how the Rioter above doesn't say anything about Dominion. Just "She has an animation, DONT EVER SPEAK OF THAT AMBOMINATION AGAIN".
I can reply to myself? What has this world become....

Everyone has forgotten what dominion is.
It's  a map where you can play some custom games like Hide and Seek, and if you break the rules and interact with the turrets strange minions spawn

Yeah, there's this on that looks like a super minion, but it's weaker than a siege minion, they only come in pairs of 3, and they give more gold than usual. Dominion is stranger than the twilight zone

Ehr... Actually Kindred HAS a capture animation. You can see it in lolking with the model viewer.
If it doesn't show up in Dominion while actually capturing towers, well, I think it could be a bug.
Don't they recycle that capture animation for things like breaking rek'sai burrows? They should probably make sure that's connected for Kin too

She also only has only one attack animation and doesn't even HAVE a crit animation. So much for the clarity they touted all season. 

They did great with everyone else all year. 

They even went out of the way to change Malphite's attacking animation when he is using brutal strikes.

But no crit animation on a Marksman?

I just don't understand.

Kindred does have a crit animation.

She stands on one-leg all fancylike and fires her arrows.
Then what does she do on Dominion Lite? AKA: When there's a Skarner in the game and she has to capture his spires?

> [{quoted}](name=DrCyanide,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bAM26puI,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-10-21T16:36:33.919+0000)
>
> Then what does she do on Dominion Lite? AKA: When there's a Skarner in the game and she has to capture his spires?

Presumably, just stares at it until she has possession of it.

Like on Dominion
Don't forget {{champion:421}}'s portals. They use part of the capturing animation as well.

> [{quoted}](name=KING OF MASKS,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bAM26puI,comment-id=00020001,timestamp=2015-10-21T18:12:51.280+0000)
>
> Don't forget {{champion:421}}'s portals. They use part of the capturing animation as well.

And {{champion:72}} 's crystal shrines.
And {{champion:412}} 's lantern.
What's Dominion?
It's the map where you play hide and seek

I'm actually not surprised it took this long to find that out with the near 1:30 wait time in that mode, though riot is missing an opportunity to have Wolf to open his mouth and an energy beam to fire out of it for the capture animation :L
People play dominion?
Now we know at least 80 people play it.
Good.
That capture animation is also used on Skarner Crystals in all the other maps, so she doesn't have it for those situations outside of dominion either.
